pages.text: This is incredible! Potions are the best discovery I've ever made! They make my job way easier now since everyone started keeping regen potions with them.

raw.text: They're kinda hard to make though... We have to kill multiple of those giant flying creatures if we want regeneration potions.

pages.text: I mean, It's not THAT hard to take them down, but they surely know how to make a mess with those fireballs of theirs.
Thankfully, those pig-looking people gave us fire resistance potions in exchange for some gold ingots. They REAAAALLY love gold. Which is quite funny...
That place is full of gold, and I've never seen a single one of them trying to mine it or anything. But anyway, I got sidetracked from the main topic.
Dr. Kal'tsit is still mad at me for exploring that dimension alone, but hey, you can't blame me for that, I needed to get back to that dimension.
Besides, it was definitely worth it, because I learned how to make potions, and now the potions are indispensable for operations.
The process was entirely trial and error, but after some time, I collected both essential ingredients in order to prepare a potion correctly.
During my exploration, I discovered that pig people live in their own bases, apparently built by them. Sadly, I couldn't get too close before being attacked.
Those guys with golden axes were not interested in gold at all, they just rushed straight up to where I was and started attacking me.
I didn't get hurt, thankfully. But, I wonder if I would have survived that if the attack had hit me....
Anyways! Back to my exploration; after traveling through multiple weird looking places, I found a castle-looking structure, Holding tightly in the ocean of lava.

raw.text: Before being able to even take a step inside the structure, I got sniped by a fireball; and I didn't even see where it came from.

pages.text: I had to throw another potion at my feet to become immune to fire again, but I still received burns on my left arm.
I'm a medic, but unlike Mulberry I can't heal burn damage, so I moved forward, ignoring the pain.
I just finished preparing a few more potions. Dr. Kal'tsit has not even thanked me for the discovery... I hope she will do it someday... But whatever, let's continue.
The castle was full of zombie pig men, but thankfully they're pretty chill if you don't disturb them. The other creatures though...
A tall, black skeleton started chasing me as soon as it saw me, so I had to block the way with blocks I collected from that world.
It should be noted that they are not very intelligent... It's kind of funny in a way. It didn't even try to duck and go underneath the barrier.
I just dug a tunnel and went on my way, discovering something truly useful shortly after.
There was a weird block, spawning a lot of fire creatures! They were the ones shooting me fireballs from afar; and let me tell you, they have INSANE aim.
The important thing here is, that killing them will make them drop the first essential ingredient for brewing potions: Rods! ...Yes, rods.
But like, fire rods. Whatever. I spent a few minutes killing a bunch of those guys, and then left that place to continue exploring the castle.
I found a couple chests along the way, getting some gold and a weirdly shaped armor... I think it's for horses in this world.
The next interesting thing happens after escaping another group of black skeletons. I found a staircase with a bunch of...crops? On both of its sides.
They weren't poisonous, so I grabbed a bit of it, as well as some dark sand to grow it later once I got back. Those crops were essential as well for potions!
I continued exploring but nothing interesting happened after that, and I ran out of fire resistance potions so I was forced to retreat.
Once I returned to our shelter at that time, I immediately went back at the lab to start experimenting with everything I gathered from that dimension.
The rods can be pulverized into powder to fuel the brewing stand, so I can finally start brewing! I wonder how I managed not to break it when I was trying to fuel it with whatever I could find.
My first potion didn't go as expected... I didn't feel any difference after drinking it, so I kept trying, using different objects and materials.
After, like... 3 hours of wasting resources and water, I prepared my first potion! I felt way stronger after drinking it. I prepared 3 more and gave one to Blaze.
She finished gathering wood in half the time she usually does! We even got time to visit a village and trade emeralds for some food.
Those red crops were the key to make proper potions, you just put them before any other ingredient, and boom! Potions for everyone, I'm so happy I discovered this, and my teammates are happy as well.
Dr. Kal'tsit is happy too, even though she doesn't often show her emotions. But I don't understand why she's still mad at me...
